DOC.brief_summary: This is a prospective, controlled, opened randomized study to evaluate the cost benefit of a primary implantation of a loop recorder versus the conventional diagnostic cascade for syncope most likely due to cardiac arrhythmia.
DOC.brief_title: ELIAS: Early Loop-Recorder in Suspected Arrhythmogenic Syncope
DOC.criteria: Two or more episodes of syncope (most likely due to cardiac arrhythmia) of uncertain etiology within the last 12 months or more than one syncope and two presyncopes Indication for the implantation of a pacemaker Indication for the implantation of an implantable cardioverter defibrillator Cardiac diseases which need intervention (KHK, aortic stenosis, mitral stenosis, left ventricular [LV] outflow stenosis, decompensated heart failure) Contraindication for a diagnostic procedure requested by the study protocol Enrollment in another study Circumstances or comorbidities which do not allow enrollment
